newsitem.title: POLAND: Polish net reserves rise to $21.67 bln in Oct 1-10.
newsitem.headline: Polish net reserves rise to $21.67 bln in Oct 1-10.

text.p: Polish net foreign currency reserves, those held in the whole banking system, grew by $99 million in October 1-10 to $21.67 billion, the National Bank of Poland said.
It said net reserves grew $1.24 billion since the start of the year.
POLISH RESERVES (bln dollars) OCT 10 SEPT OCT 95
NOTE - Figures in billions of dollars. Official reserves are those held by the state. Net reserves mean the total amount of hard currencies in the whole banking system.
